TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE , the GPE . He is represented before the ORG by Mr M.P.H. Winters , a lawyer practising in GPE , the GPE .

The applicant is the author of a computer programme for the calculation of amounts of maintenance to be used by national courts . The programme was published by the PERSON publishing company . The applicant ’s programme tested best in a trial in which CARDINAL other programmes participated but the authors of CARDINAL of the other programmes , PERSON , obtained an injunction when PERSON started advertising the applicant ’s programme in legal journals - the test results had allegedly been ‘ ORG at the instigation of the authors of the third programme who were attached to a regional court . PERSON then attempted to get the applicant and PERSON and PERSON to work together but the applicant refused . Subsequently , PERSON decided to publish the programme of PERSON and W.

The applicant started proceedings for damages against both PERSON and PERSON and PERSON , arguing that their actions had caused him to lose his advantage which the test results had given him from a marketing point of view . In the proceedings against ORG ( Gerechtshof ) of GPE decided on DATE that ORG actions had indeed caused prejudice to the applicant and in a separate procedure the amount of damages to be paid by PERSON to the applicant should be calculated .

In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG ( Arrondissementsrechtbank ) of PERSON ordered PERSON to pay a certain amount of damages ( PERCENT of what the applicant had demanded ) , rejected the applicant ’s other demands in respect of PERSON ( namely that PERSON halt its publication of PERSON and PERSON ’s programme ) and declared the applicant ’s claims on PERSON and PERSON inadmissible as it held that these claims covered the same damage as the applicant claimed from ORG On DATE ORG of GPE quashed this decision , but only insofar as the amount of damages was concerned ( ORG lowered this amount ) . It held that the applicant ’s claim on PERSON was admissible , but rejected this claim because PERSON had not acted unlawfully towards the applicant and ORG also agreed with ORG that the applicant ’s claims on PERSON were the same as those on PERSON .

The applicant filed an appeal in cassation with ORG ( PERSON ) , raising a number of complaints relating to the reasoning applied by ORG and also arguing that there was a contradiction between ORG judgments of DATE and that of DATE . According to the applicant , these circumstances created at least the impression that the lower courts , most of whose judges where also contractually connected to the Kluwer company , had not been impartial . The applicant requested ORG in writing to appoint judges to this case who had no ties with PERSON .

In the proceedings before ORG the Advocate - General at that court submitted an advisory opinion to which the applicant was able to reply . In his response he pointed out that this particular Advocate - General had had a number of written works published by PERSON in the time before he became Advocate - General .
On DATE ORG rejected the appeal in cassation . CARDINAL of the CARDINAL ORG judges have had written works published by ORG or companies part of the PERSON conglomerate .

Pursuant to LAW ) a party may challenge any of the judges assigned to examine a case on the grounds of facts or circumstances which might prejudice the judicial impartiality . A request to challenge a judge should be made as soon as the person concerned has become familiar with these facts or circumstances ( LAW ) .

Article XIII § CARDINAL of the Rules of Court of ORG ( Reglement van Orde van de Hoge Raad der Nederlanden ) provides that at the request of one of the parties to the proceedings the Registrar will notify to that party the names of the members of ORG who will render judgment in a particular case .

The duties and position of the Procurator - General ’s department ( openbaar ministerie ) are defined in ORG ( Wet op de rechterlijke organisatie ) . PERSON department consists of ORG and advocates - general of ORG , the procurators - general and advocates - general of the courts of appeal and the public prosecutor ’s of the regional and district courts ( LAW ) . The advocates - general of ORG act as deputies of the Procurator - General of that court and are subordinate to him ( Articles CARDINAL § CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) .

The Procurator - General ’s department must be heard by the courts in so far as the law so prescribes ( DATE ) . The advisory opinion of the Procurator - General or an advocate - general to ORG takes the form of a learned treatise containing references to relevant case - law and legal literature and a recommendation , which is not binding on ORG , to uphold or reject points of appeal .
